messages.content: In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Find Mural provider API reference/documentation link

Public Mural API docs: https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started
Enterprise API docs: https://developers.mural.co/enterprise/docs/welcome

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Where can I create account and app for Mural provider?

Sing up via this link: https://app.mural.co/signup
To create a new app go here and click the New app button: https://app.mural.co/me/apps. First, provide the app name and redirect URI. Then you will get the client ID and client secret.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Give me list of all Mural provider API scopes
There is the list of all scopes: rooms:read, users:read, workspaces:read, murals:read, identity:read, templates:read, rooms:write, murals:write, templates:write

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
What are the different types of authentications Mural provider supports?
Public mural API uses OAuth2 Authentication. You can read more about OAuath2 authentication here: https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/oauth

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
For Mural provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in Mural provider API?
Access token expires in 15 minutes. I didn't find information about refresh token expiration time.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
What entities or objects could be queried via the Mural provider API? Provide links to the API documentation for each object or entity:

Here are some of the main API entities that can be queried via the Mural API:
1)Rooms - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/rooms
2)Users - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/users
3)Workspaces - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/workspaces
4)Murals - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/murals
5)Templates - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/templates
6)Mural Contents - https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/mural-contents

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Give information about Mural provider API rate limits

Mural has a User rate limit and a Client application rate limit.
User rate limit: 25 requests/user/second
Client application rate limit: 10,000/app/min

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
For Mural provider API give me information about what rate limit headers are returned in response:

Mural API returns rate limit headers in response. Here are the headers:
1)X-RateLimit-Limit - User rate limit
2)X-RateLimit-Remaining - How many requests are available for the user until the rate limit reset
3)X-RateLimit-Reset - Timestamp when the user rate limit will reset
4)X-RateLimit-App-Limit - Client application rate limit
5)X-RateLimit-App-Remaining - How many requests are available for the client application until the rate limit reset
6)X-RateLimit-App-Reset - Timestamp when the client application rate limit will reset

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Does Mural provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in Mural provider API?

According to this changelog: https://developers.mural.co/public/changelog/mural-api-changelog-2022-11-15 create sticky note endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createstickynote), create text box endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createtextbox) and create title endpoint(https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/createtitle) supports bulk operations.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
Mural provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits

Mural uses token pagination. Each resource type has its own default page size of 100 or fewer. 
Mural uses two pagination query params limit and next. With the next key use the token to get access to the next page

What is the error response format in Mural provider API?

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Mural. All information about Mural you can get from this site(s): https://developers.mural.co/public/docs/getting-started, https://developers.mural.co/public/reference/intro
The version of the restful API is usually a part of the endpoint url, e.g. for version 4 the url looks like http://example.com/users/v4/1234/. How many versions of such api is available for Mural?:
The current version of Mural API is v1

Do the Mural developers publish API changelog information? If so tell me where i can find Mural changelog and give me a link with Mural changelog
You can find Mural API changelog here: https://developers.mural.co/public/changelog
In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Wrike. All information about Wrike you can get from this site(s): https://developers.wrike.com/

https://developers.wrike.com/overview/
In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Wrike. All information about Wrike you can get from this site(s): https://developers.wrike.com/
Where can I create account and app for Wrike provider?

Create an account at: https://www.wrike.com/vak/. After this confirm your email.
Create an app here: https://www.wrike.com/frontend/apps/index.html#/api.
In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Wrike. All information about Wrike you can get from this site(s): https://developers.wrike.com/
Give me list of all Wrike provider API scopes

In API Reference you can find required scopes for every endpoint. For example, https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#query-contacts endpoint needs to have one of three scopes: Default, wsReadOnly, wsReadWrite.

There is the list of all scopes: Default, wsReadOnly, wsReadWrite, amReadOnlyUser, amReadWriteUser, amReadOnlyGroup, amReadWriteGroup, amReadOnlyInvitation, amReadWriteInvitation, amReadOnlyWorkflow, amReadWriteWorkflow, amReadOnlyTimelogCategory, amReadWriteTimelogCategory, dataExportFull, amReadOnlyAuditLog, amReadOnlyAccessRole, amReadOnlyWorkSchedule, amReadWriteWorkSchedule
In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Wrike. All information about Wrike you can get from this site(s): https://developers.wrike.com/
What are the different types of authentications Wrike provider supports?
Wrike supports OAuth2 and permanent token(API key) authentication types.

Wrike API supports offset-based pagination. The maximum number of items per page is 1000.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Find Klaviyo provider API reference/documentation link
https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/api_overview

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Where can I create account and app for Klaviyo provider?

Create an account at https://www.klaviyo.com/sign-up.
To create a client app go to https://www.klaviyo.com/oauth/client and click Create app button in the top right corner.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Give me list of all Klaviyo provider API scopes

Each endpoint has 2 associated scopes.
There is the list of all scopes: accounts:read, accounts:write, catalogs:read, catalogs:write, conversations:read, conversations:write, coupons:read, coupons:write, coupon-codes:read, coupon-codes:write, campaigns:read, campaigns:write, data-privacy:read, data-privacy:write, events:read, events:write, flows:read, flows:write, images:read, images:write, lists:read, lists:write, metrics:read, metrics:write, profiles:read, profiles:write, push-tokens:read, push-tokens:write, segments:read, segments:write, subscriptions:read, subscriptions:write, tags:read, tags:write, templates:read, templates:write

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
What are the different types of authentications Klaviyo provider supports?
Klaviyo supports OAuth2(https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/set_up_oauth) and API key authentication types.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
For Klaviyo provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in Klaviyo provider API?
Access token expires after 1 hour, refresh token expires after 90 days. Refresh token can be called 10 times per minute maximum.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
What entities or objects could be queried via the Klaviyo provider API? Provide links to the API documentation for each object or entity:

Here are some of the main API entities that can be queried via the Klaviyo API:
1)Profiles - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/profiles
2)Lists - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/lists
3)Campaigns - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/campaigns
4)Flows - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/flows
5)Metrics - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/metrics
6)Tags - https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference/tags

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Give information about Klaviyo provider API rate limits

OAuth apps receive their own rate limit quota per account per app.
Private key integrations share the same rate limit quota per account.
If you have a Private key, and two OAuth apps they all will have different rate limit quotas. (https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/set_up_oauth#rate-limits)
Each API endpoint has different rate limit. API uses fixed-window rate limiting algorithm with two distinct windows:
burst window(1-second window)
steady window(1-minute window)

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
For Klaviyo provider API give me information about what rate limit headers are returned in response:

Klaviyo API returns rate limit headers in response. Here are the headers:
1)RateLimit-Limit - Number of requests allowed per time period
2)RateLimit-Remaining - Approximate number of requests remaining within a window
3)RateLimit-Reset - Number of seconds remaining before current window resets

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Does Klaviyo provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in Klaviyo provider API?
Klaviyo supports Bulk Profile Import (https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/use_klaviyos_bulk_profile_import_api)

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called Klaviyo. All information about Klaviyo you can get from this site(s): https://developers.klaviyo.com/en, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/docs/changelog_, https://developers.klaviyo.com/en/reference
Klaviyo provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits

Klaviyo supports cursor based pagination with query parameter ?page[cursor].
In every pagination request you will recieve three links. Using this link you can get to the next page or previous page.

All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
Where can I create account and app for RingCentral provider?

Create account on this link https://developers.ringcentral.com/sign-up. After this activate your account via message on email.
To create oauth2 app go to: https://developers.ringcentral.com/my-account.html#/applications

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
Give me list of all RingCentral provider API scopes

Required scopes are generally declared at the stage of application registration and confirmed by the user during the authorization stage of connecting to that application.

Adding and removing scopes is accomplished in the Developer Console by editing the application's settings.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
What are the different types of authentications RingCentral provider supports?

OAuth2: https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide/authentication/auth-code-flow
OAuth2 with PKCE: https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide/authentication/auth-code-pkce-flow
JWT: https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide/authentication/jwt-flow
Password auth(deprecated): https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide/authentication/password-flo

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
For RingCentral provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in RingCentral provider API?
Access token expires after 1 hour, refresh token expires after 7 days.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
What entities or objects could be queried via the RingCentral provider API? Provide links to the API documentation for each object or entity:

Here are some of the main API entities that can be queried via the RingCentral API:
1)Account - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/account
2)Voice - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/voice
3)SMS and Fax - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/sms-and-fax
4)Social Messaging - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/social-messaging
5)Team Messaging - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/team-messaging
6)Video - https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/video

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
Give information about RingCentral provider API rate limits

Every API endpoint assigned to different API Group with different Rate Limit. 
Light - 50 requests/minute
Medium - 40 requests/minute
Heavy - 10 requests/minute
Auth - 5 requests/minute

To see to which group the endpoint belongs go to API reference(https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/) select any API group from left menu and select any endpoint. For example https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/Adaptive-Cards/createGlipAdaptiveCardNew endpoint. In the description you can see Usage Plan Group

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
For RingCentral provider API give me information about what rate limit headers are returned in response:

RingCentral API returns rate limit headers in response. Here are the headers:
1)X-Rate-Limit-Limit - current rate limit for the given request
2)X-Rate-Limit-Remaining - current rate limit for the given request
3)X-Rate-Limit-Window - current rate limit for the given request
4)X-Rate-Limit-Group - current rate limit for the given request

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
Does RingCentral provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in RingCentral provider API?
You can find information about batch operations here: Link: https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide/basics/batch-requests

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called RingCentral. All information about RingCentral you can get from this site(s): https://developers.ringcentral.com/, https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference, https://developers.ringcentral.com/guide
RingCentral provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits

It seems like RingEX API supports different types of pagination. For example https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/Calendar-Events/readGlipEventsNew endpoint supports token(cursor) pagination. Maximum recordCount is 250. Default - 30. And https://developers.ringcentral.com/api-reference/Call-Blocking/listBlockedAllowedNumbers endpoint supports link pagination. It seems like  maximum page limit for this endpoint is 1000. Default - 100.

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called AdobeSign. All information about AdobeSign you can get from this site(s): https://opensource.adobe.com/acrobat-sign/, https://secure.na1.adobesign.com/public/docs/restapi/v6
Give me list of all AdobeSign provider API scopes

There are 3 scopes: user_read, user_write, user_login, agreement_read, agreement_write, agreement_send, widget_read, widget_write, library_read, library_write, workflow_read, workflow_write, webhook_read, webhook_write, webhook_retention, application_read, application_write.
Each scope has one of three modifiers: self, group, account.

What are the different types of authentications AdobeSign provider supports?
Adobe sign supports OAuth2 (https://secure.na1.adobesign.com/public/static/oauthDoc.jsp) and integration key (https://helpx.adobe.com/sign/kb/how-to-create-an-integration-key.html).

For AdobeSign provider tell me in what time access and refresh tokens expires in AdobeSign provider API?
Access token expires after 1 hour, refresh token expires after 60 days.

Give information about AdobeSign provider API rate limits

General info about throttling from https://helpx.adobe.com/sign/using/transaction-limits.html
"Each request to Acrobat Sign is evaluated based on the amount of system resources it consumes. Different parameters passed to the same endpoint might contribute to a different amount of resource consumption.
Furthermore, some requests may trigger lengthy background processes that are also considered in the throttling evaluation algorithm.
Therefore, the rate of requests can not be described as simple numbers of requests in a certain period of time. Throttling policies are based on historical daily request data, including legitimate usages that stress the system.
Customers can be assured that the Acrobat Sign policies are generous enough that regular daily workflow volume will not be affected."

Does AdobeSign provider API support batch or bulk operations? What API endpoints support batch or bulk operations in AdobeSign provider API?

In this conversation, you provide information about the API of a provider. The provider is called AdobeSign. All information about AdobeSign you can get from this site(s): https://opensource.adobe.com/acrobat-sign/, https://secure.na1.adobesign.com/public/docs/restapi/v6
AdobeSign provider in API supports link based or offset based pagination? Tell me about pagination limits

Adobe sign use cursor based pagination. Page size limited by pageSize query param. If you don't set page size you will receive all list of resources (https://opensource.adobe.com/acrobat-sign/releasenotes/v6releasenotes.html#pagination-support). In pagination request if you have next page you will receive "nextCursor" key in response body.
